title: At five years old, Institute for Human-Centered AI looks to the future
snippet: In HAI’s five years of operation, the institute has focused on policy, research and education and has funded the research projects of more than 400 faculty, said HAI co-founder and co-director James Landay, a computer science professor.

title: Fei-Fei Li - Wikipedia
snippet: Fei-Fei Li (Chinese: 李飞飞; pinyin: Lǐ Fēifēi; born in Beijing, China, July 3, 1976) is a Chinese-born American computer scientist known for her pioneering work in artificial intelligence (AI), particularly in computer vision. She is best known for establishing ImageNet, the dataset ...

title: Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) | LinkedIn
snippet: Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) | 91,795 followers on LinkedIn. Advancing AI research, education, policy, and practice to improve humanity. | At Stanford HAI, our vision for the future is led by our commitment to studying, guiding and developing human-centered AI technologies and applications.

title: Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) | Stanford Online
snippet: Stanford founded the Institute for Human-Centered AI in 2019 to guide and build the future of AI.HAI advances AI research, education, policy and practice to improve the human condition. Led by faculty from multiple departments across Stanford, research focuses on developing AI technologies inspired by human intelligence; studying, forecasting and guiding the human and societal impact of AI; and designing and creating AI applications that augment human capabilities.
